item.title: PS VR2 price dropped to $399
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/ps-vr2-price-dropped-to-399

  • PS VR2
  • PS5

A $150 price cut.

Sony Interactive Entertainment will drop the recommended retail price of PlayStation VR2 from $549.99 / €599.99 / £529.99 / ¥74,980 to $399.99 / €449.99 / £399.99 / ¥66,980 starting in March, the company announced.

Both the standard PlayStation VR2 package—which includes the PlayStation VR2 headset, Sense controllers, and stereo headphones—and the PlayStation VR2 Horizon Call of the Mountain Bundle—which includes the PlayStation VR2 package content plus a voucher code for Horizon Call of the Mountain—will be available at the new price point.

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii opens at 105,161 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of February 17, 2025 to February 23, 2025.

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 68,219 copies on PlayStation 5 and 36,942 copies on PlayStation 4 for a total of 105,161 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 39,172 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 13,556 units, the Xbox Series family sold 1,535 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 22 units.

item.title: Fuga: Melodies of Steel 3 debut trailer, details, and screenshots
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/fuga-melodies-of-steel-3-debut-trailer-details-and-screenshots

CyberConnect2 has released the first trailer, as well as new information and screenshots for Fuga: Melodies of Steel 3, the finale to its RPG trilogy.

Get the details below.

■ The Taranis’s Awakens New Powers! Take the Battle to the Skies!

The children return to fight in the Taranis once again, automatically donning special suits during battle!

—The Taranis’s Final Form: The Omega Taranis

—Soar through the skies with Aerial Mode!

—Navigational Assistant: Chathie

—The elusive Maestro makes his return!

■ The Berman Imperial Army Stands in the Children’s Way!

—First Emperor of the Berman Empire: Leber Kaiser

—The Most Powerful of the Enhanced Berman Forces: The Crimson Knights

■ New Thrilling and Strategic Battle Systems

New: Weakness Combo

Launching successful consecutive attacks on the enemy’s weak point increases the combo damage!​

Activate Burst Attack at MAX gauge to deal even more damage!

New: Multi-Leader Skills​

Every child has their own special leader skill, which activates at random!

New: Assist System

Past enemies, comrades, and legendary figures join the battle when a bond is formed!​ When the Assist Bar is maxed out, they will be summoned to strike the enemy. Unlock special events to reveal characters’ hidden pasts.​

—Vanilla debuts as an Assist Character in Fuga: Melodies of Steel 3!

New: The Soul Cannon’s Devastating Evolution

A child who senses an imminent defeat will lay down their lives so that their comrades may forge on!

—Quietly, they succumb to their despair!

—When a child reaches their limit, they take themselves to the Soul Cannon Chamber

—That child will sacrifice themselves so that their comrades can forge on!

Prevent the children from firing the Soul Cannon!

■ Save File Bonus

Earn bonuses for the endings you achieved in Fuga: Melodies of Steel 1 and 2!

  • PlayedThrough​ Fuga: Melodies of Steel
    • Costume​ “Old Memories (Noir)”
  • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ Play Data
    • Costume​ “Daily Clothes (Golden)”
    • Set of Items (An assembly of items to help with early battles)
  • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ Normal Ending Data​
    • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ play data bonus
    • Additional music to play on the jukebox during intermission​ (“Flower on the Trails:​ Piano ver.”)
  • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ True Ending Data​​
    • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ play data bonus
    • Fuga: Melodies of Steel 2​ normal ending data bonuses
    • Memorial photos can be viewed during intermission​ at the photo stand.

Fuga: Melodies of Steel 3 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store on May 29.

item.title: ToHeart remake for PC launches June 26 worldwide; debut trailer, screenshots, and comparison video
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/toheart-remake-for-pc-launches-june-26-worldwide-debut-trailer-screenshots-and-comparison-video

  • PC
  • Switch

PC version published by DMM Games and Shiravune.

The PC (Steam) version of the ToHeart remake will be a global release supporting English, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese language options, publishers Shiravune and DMM Games, and developer Aquaplus announced. Both the global PC release and Japanese Switch release are due out on June 26. It is currently unclear whether the Switch version will feature English and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The late ’90s landmark visual novel from Aquaplus is back and fully remastered!

  • 3D scenes and animations!
  • Updated art in full high-definition, with modern Windows support!
  • Your choice of classic or all-new voiceovers!
  • English and Chinese in addition to Japanese!

Discover the “heartful love comedy” that has captivated Japanese hearts for over a decade!

  • ❮
  • ❯

Story

Spring is almost here!

Strolling down a street paved with pastel tiles, the sun warms my back as pigeons flock by the roadside. Amid this everyday scenery, it’s another ordinary morning, with just a soft whisper of spring on the wind.

“It’s a little warmer again today, huh?” Akari pipes up as she turns her eyes to me, her bangs swaying gently in the breeze. “I guess winter’s over.”

“I guess it is,” I answer offhandedly, and Akari giggles. I don’t know why.

ToHeart is a “heartful,” heartfelt, and comedic multiple-ending visual novel.

The protagonist is an utterly ordinary young man, but his friends Akari, Masashi, and Shiho make every day a happy one.

As winter turns to spring and March turns to April, the wind also carries a whisper of love.

item.title: Calamity Angels: Special Delivery debut trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/calamity-angels-special-delivery-debut-trailer

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out on June 26 in Japan, this summer in the west.

Compile Heart has released the debut trailer for delivery service RPG Calamity Angels: Special Delivery.

Here is an overview of the game, via western publisher Idea Factory International:

About

Lead a rag-tag group of kooky carriers in this delivery service RPG as they protect and trek packages through treacherous terrains, unruly monsters, and meet other sneaky delivery service teams ready to stake their claim as the best delivery service in the Orkotris Region!

A new adventure awaits with every package!

Key Features

  • In the Mood for Battle? – Running a tip-top delivery service means mailing out orders AND keeping your crew in check. Watch their moods—if they’re unhappy, they might ignore your commands, but their negligence could deliver positive surprises and even victories in battle!
  • Out for Delivery! – Head to the Bulletin Board and see what deliveries await! Inspect the parcel, pack it tightly (no gaps allowed!), and assemble your crew with the right gear (to bonk any pesky foes) and tools for a smooth drop-off. Each successful drop-off delivers sweet rewards your way, so handle with care!
  • Delivery in Three-to-Five Business Days (Unless you Run into a Boss) – Start your adventure with a roulette spin to determine your next move. Land on shop spaces for goodies, collect special packages for rewards, and maybe tackle some sneaky bosses along the way!
  • Kei Nanameda… Delivers! – From the character designer of Mary Skelter and Death end re;Quest, Kei Nanameda presents a fresh delivery service world with lively dialogue, intense battles, and a quirky cast full of energy!

Calamity Angels: Special Delivery is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on June 26 in Japan, and this summer in the west.
